Name: sun
Blurb: The center of Earth’s orbit and the star of our solar system.

Name: mercury
Blurb: The smallest planet in the solar system and the closest planet to the sun.

Name: venus
Blurb: The second planet from the sun and often called the Earth’s “sister planet” due to their similarities in size and mass.

Name: earth
Blurb: There’s no doubt you’re familiar with this one. 71% water and populated by billions of humans, the Earth is certainly unique.

Name: mars
Blurb: Mars is also known as the Red Planet due to the iron oxide on its surface.

Name: jupiter
Blurb: A gas giant and the largest planet in our solar system. It’s famous “Red Spot” is actually a huge storm.

Name: saturn
Blurb: It’s famous rings are made out of ice particles, rock debris, and dust.

Name: uranus
Blurb: Uranus is unique in our solar system because it’s axis of rotation is sideways.

Name: neptune
Blurb: Though Neptune (and Uranus) are considered gas giants, some also call them ice giants due to their high composition of ices.

Name: moon
Blurb: The Earth isn’t the only planet with a moon, but it’s the only one that man has set foot on.

Name: asteroid
Blurb: The asteroid belt is between Jupiter and Mars and contains millions of asteroids.

Name: comet
Blurb: The most famous comet is Halley’s Comet, which is only visible from Earth every 75 years.

Name: pluto
Blurb: While it’s not a planet, nine dwarf planets like Pluto also help make up our solar system.
